lexUnit.name: smear.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: coat or mark with a greasy or sticky substance.

sentence.text: She had a fake -- a trick : just before the contest started she smeared her mouth well with butter .
He did not even notice when one of his class became stuck in the hole in the floorboards and was there all day until Endill had the idea of smearing him with butter to slide him out .
They were both bareheaded , but had smeared their faces with camouflage cream , and wore dark coloured zip-up windcheaters , denims and trainers .
He had smeared the shape with coal dust .
At all times , the BBC and official propaganda has been industrious at smearing them with crime and violence .
He smeared the chicken with edenwort , okra and gravy , rubbed it round the plate and set it off once more in the direction of his wide , beautifully moulded mouth .
He promptly took it out of her hand , smeared it with honey and pushed it towards her mouth .
She was smearing her hands with iron oxide , to simulate blood .
Opening trick : stop nail polish bottle tops from sticking by smearing the grooves with some Vaseline .
The women of the family struck their faces and smeared them with soot .

They also knew that the arrested men were respectable and law-abiding and they were highly indignant when they heard that an official spokesman had smeared them with the suggestion of criminal activities .
Bryony took the toast out and began to smear it with tomato chutney .
The man 's face was a glistening red , as though he had smeared it with Vaseline .
In this case , straight sections of Kopex connectors were pushed into Acorn connectors after the pipe ends had been smeared with lubricant .
In nineteenth-century Paris young revellers would melt down chocolate and smear horrified passers-by with what they took to be excrement .

They gave the impression of being a hunting party -- not far from the truth , Grant thought , but for the fact that many carried baseball bats and all had their faces heavily smeared with camouflage cream .
Put the meat into a roasting pan , join-side down , smear with olive oil and sprinkle with salt .
Traditional packing can be replaced with wool smeared with petroleum jelly ; some modern nonrising spindle taps have rubber ( or neoprene ) ` O'-ring seals which are easily replaced .
